Description:
The read interaction enables the look up of a MedicationRequest resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction is typically used to:

  • Retrieve specific MedicationRequest data that was referenced in another resource.
  • Initiate a contextual launch where the runtime context is a specific MedicationRequest.

This resource can return various types of medications, including inpatient-ordered medications, clinic-administered medications (CAMS), patient-reported medications, and reconciled medications from Care Everywhere and other external sources.

The R4 version of this resource also returns patient-reported medications. Previously, patient-reported medications were not returned by the STU3 version of MedicationRequest and needed to be queried using the STU3 MedicationStatement resource. This is no longer the case. The R4 version of this resource returns patient-reported medications with the reportedBoolean element set to True. If the informant is known, it is also specified in the reportedReference element.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to view medications.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view medications in MyChart.

MedicationRequest.Name: MedicationRequest
MedicationRequest.Description: An instance of the R4 MedicationRequest FHIR resource.

authoredOn.Name: authoredOn
authoredOn.Description: The date the prescription was written.

basedOn.Name: basedOn
basedOn.Description:
Reference to one or both of the following:
  • A CarePlan resource corresponding to the treatment plan or therapy plan from which the medication was ordered.
  • A MedicationRequest resource corresponding to the order template. Included if the order is from a treatment or therapy plan. This type of reference is available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic or starting in the May 2021 version by special update.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of medication usage. There are three categories:
  • Inpatient
  • Outpatient (those administered in the clinic - CAMS)
  • Community (prescriptions)

numberOfRepeatsAllowed.Name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
numberOfRepeatsAllowed.Description: The number of discrete refills for the medication.

validityPeriod.Name: validityPeriod
validityPeriod.Description: The start and end date for the medication. If the medication is a prescription and is not discontinued, this element doesn't include an end date.

doseQuantity.Name: doseQuantity
doseQuantity.Description: Amount of medication per dose. The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.

rateQuantity.Name: rateQuantity
rateQuantity.Description: Amount of medication per unit of time.

type.Name: type
type.Description:
The kind of dose or rate specified. Supported code values include:
  • ordered
  • calculated
  • admin-amount

patientInstruction.Name: patientInstruction
patientInstruction.Description:
The patient instructions for the prescription.

For a multi-line sig, this is the same.

sequence.Name: sequence
sequence.Description: This element is populated only for multi-line sigs.

text.Name: text
text.Description:
The patient instructions for the prescription.

For a multi-line sig, this is the same.

boundsPeriod.Name: boundsPeriod
boundsPeriod.Description: The start and end dates for the medication.

count.Name: count
count.Description: If the medication is not PRN, and CountType is Doses, this element is populated with the count value.

countMax.Name: countMax
countMax.Description: If the medication is PRN, this element is set to Count.

duration.Name: duration
duration.Description: The medication duration. If duration is expressed as a range, this element is populated with the minimum duration.

durationMax.Name: durationMax
durationMax.Description: If duration is expressed as a range, this element is populated with the maximum duration.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to the encounter resource that the request was placed on.

groupIdentifier.Name: groupIdentifier
groupIdentifier.Description: The group ID and index for linked orders.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: Returns “plan” for patient-reported and historical medications. Returns “order” for other medications.

medicationReference.Name: medicationReference
medicationReference.Description: The FHIR ID representation of the ordered medication. The ID is an encoded ORD and ERX.

note.Name: note
note.Description: Comments from the medication order, and additional notes regarding linked orders. Comments are not returned to patients.

priorPrescription.Name: priorPrescription
priorPrescription.Description: The ID of the order from which this order was reordered.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: The provider ID. Otherwise, the user ID.

requester.Name: requester
requester.Description: Who made the request. Starting in August 2021, this element can include a Data Absent Reason Extension if the requester is unknown.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the medication request.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Who the medication request is for.

allowedBoolean.Name: allowedBoolean
allowedBoolean.Description: Whether substitution is allowed or not.

supportingInformation.Name: supportingInformation
supportingInformation.Description: This element is used for linked orders.
